tagline: An Act to revoke and annual certain Bills passed by the National Assembly

THE REVOCATION  OF PRIVILE GES ACT,  1992  
 
 
 
 
 
CONTENTS  
 
1. Short title and commencement 
2. Annulment of certain Bills  
 

 
Page 2 of 2 
 THE REVOCATION  OF PRIVILE GES ACT,  1992  
 
ACT  No. VIII of 1992  
 
An Act to revoke and annual certain  Bills passed by the National  Assembly 
 
WHEREAS it is expedient to revoke  and annual the Bills passed by the National 
Assembly on the 3rd day of May, 1992;  
 
AND WHERE AS the National Assembly unanimously by a Resolution  on May, 7, 1992,  
resolved to withd raw the said Bills; 
 
It is hereby enacted as follows  :⸻ 
 
1. Short title and commencement.—(1) This Act may be called the Revocation of 
Privileges Act, 1992.  
 
(2) It shall come into force at once and shall be deemed to have come into force on and 
from the 3rd day of May, 1992.  
 
2. Annulment of certain Bills.⸻ Notwi thstanding  anything contained in any other law or 
the rules for the time being in force, the President’s Salary, Allow ances and Privileges 
(Amendment) Bill, 1992,  the Prime Minist er’s Salary, Allow ances and Privileges (Amendment) 
Bill, 1992,  the Federal Minist ers and Minist ers of State Salaries, Allow ances and Privileges 
(Amendment) Bill, 1992,  the Members of Parliament (Salaries and Allow ances) (Amendment) 
Bill, 1992,  the Chairman and Speaker (Salaries, Allow ances and Privileges) (Amendment) Bill, 
1992,  and the Deputy Chairman and Deputy Speaker (Salaries, Allowances and Privileges) 
(Amendment) Bill, 1992,  passed by the National Assembly of Pakistan on the 3rd day of May, 
1992,  resolved to be withd rawn by a unanimous  Resolution of the National Assembly, whether 
transmitt ed to the President for his assent or not, or whether deemed to have become Acts of 
Parliament by afflux of time or not, are withd rawn, revoked and annulled and shall be deemed 
always to have been withdrawn, revoked and annulled and of no legal effect.
